intro: Parakmeria kachirachirai, commonly known as the Kachirachira melon, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons. The plant is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a spherical, fleshy berry that is typically yellow or orange when ripe.
